meanings.definition: A type of bread typically braided and eaten on Jewish holidays.
meanings.sent1: During Hanukkah, we always enjoy delicious challah with our family.
meanings.sent2: The challah at the bakery looked so tempting, I had to buy a loaf.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook the challah for a scarf because of its braided shape!
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked challah filled the kitchen, making it feel like home.
meanings.sent5: The golden crust of the challah glistened under the kitchen lights.

meanings.definition: To make or eat challah bread.
meanings.sent1: Every Friday, we gather in the kitchen to challah together as a family.
meanings.sent2: I love to challah with honey for a sweet treat.
meanings.sent3: I challahed so much last night that I dreamt of braided bread!
meanings.sent4: She challahed her way through the entire loaf in one sitting.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of baking challah always makes me hungry.
